adjectives.description: quilly (comparative more quilly, superlative most quilly)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to or resembling a quill. [from 16th c.]
examples: The fabrick of the wing, as it appears through a moderately magnifying Microscope, seems to be a body consisting of two parts […]; the one is a quilly or finny substance, consisting of several long, slender and variously bended quills or wires, something resembling the veins of leaves […].
[…]  sometimes you may even run across a quilly ball lying right on top of the ledge, or catch one of the numerous porcupine family picking its way leisurely among the rocks.
